title: Tintagel
summary: Tintagel (/tɪnˈtædʒəl/) or Trevena (Cornish: Tre war Venydh[1] meaning village on a mountain) is a civil parish and village situated on the Atlantic coast of Cornwall, England. The village and nearby Tintagel Castle are associated with the legends surrounding King Arthur and in recent times  has become a tourist attraction.[2]
